item.title: Private forest landowner demographics compared to the US population
item.description: Private individuals own a third of the nationâ€™s forests. These private landowners value them primarily due to the beauty, natural values, and wildlife habitat they provide. Forests owned by private non-industrial individuals are diverse: they vary in terms of species composition, structure, and management objectives. While privately-owned forests are diverse, the demographics of their owners are not. Data from the National Woodland Owner Survey, a program administered by the USDA Forest Service, indicate that the primary decision makers on private forestlands are older, predominantly male, White, and non-Hispanic.
